intro: Hieracium asplundii, commonly known as the Asplund's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually hairy and serrated. Hieracium asplundii is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions.
